titleStmt.title:
An Excellent New Song being the Intended
Speech of a Famous Orator against Peace

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: An Orator Dismal of Nottinghamshire
Who has forty years let out his Conciene to hire
Out of Zeal for his Country & want of a place
Is come up vi & armis to break the Q──'s peace
He has vamp't up an old Speech & the Court to their Sorrow
Shall here him Harrange agt Prior to Morrow
When once he begins he never will flinch
But repeats the same Note a whole day like a Finch
I have heard all the Speech repeated by Hoppy
And mistakes to prevent I have obtained a Coppy

The Speech
Whereas Notwithstanding I am in great pain
To hear we are Making a peace without Spain
But Most Noble Senators it is a great Shame
There should be a Peace whilst I'me Not-in-game
The D── shou'd me all his fine House & the D──'s
From her closet Brought out a Full Purse in her Clutches
I talk't of a peace and the both gave a Start
His G── swore by ──── & her Grace let a F────t
My Long old fashion'd Pocket was presently cramn'd
And sooner than vote for a peace I'lle be D────nd
But some will cry Turn-coat & rip up old stories
How I alwayes pretended to be for the Tories
I answer Tories were all in my good Graces
Till all my Relations were put into places
But still I am in Principles ever the same
And will quit my best friends while I'me Not-in-game
When I and some others subscribed our Names
To a plot for Expelling my Master K──ng I──mes
I withdrew my Subscription by help of a Blot
And so might Discouer or gain by the Plot
I had my advantage and stood all Defiance
For Danniel was got from the Den of the Lyons
I came in without danger & was I to blame
For rather than hang I would be Not-in-game.
I swore to the Q──n that the Pr── of H────r
During her Sacred life should never come over
I made use of a Trope that an Heir to invite
was like keeping her monument always in Sight
But when I thought proper I alter'd my note
And in her own hearing I boldly did vote
That her Majesty stood in great need of a Tutor
And must have an old or a new Co-adjutor
For why I would fain have put all in a flame
Because for some Reasons I am Not-in-game
Now my new benefactors have brought me about
And I'le vote against Peace with Spain or without
Tho the Court gives my Brothers & nephews & Cousins
And all my whole family places by Dosens
Yet sinee I know where a full purse may be found
And hardly pay eighteen-pence box in the Pound
Since the Tories have thus dissappointed my hopes
I'le neither regard any figures or Tropes
I'le speake against Peace whilst Dismal's my Name
And be a True whigg whilst I am Not-in-game
